medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks prior to presentation, characterized by chest discomfort described as a sensation of fullness in the center of the chest without radiation, and dyspnea. Symptoms did not occur at rest and there were no additional symptoms such as light-headedness or syncope.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypertension, dyslipidemia, obstructive sleep apnea; previously underwent echocardiography 3 years prior which showed mild left ventricular hypertrophy but otherwise normal cardiac structure and function.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hypertrophic cardiomyopathy; no family history of premature coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: Patient did not smoke, drinks alcohol rarely, and reported no illicit drug use.
